item.title: Anceint magics alter
item.dc:creator: @smkscape smkscape
item.description:
@smkscape wrote:

Ok first make a new global objeckt
first Search for

makeglobal

Then you will see somfting like this :

makeGlobalObject(3509, 9496, 3831, 0, 10); makeGlobalObject(2974, 3372, 2783, 0, 10); makeGlobalObject(2940, 3353, 2109, 0, 10); makeGlobalObject(2940, 3352, 2109, 0, 10); makeGlobalObject(2940, 3351, 2091, 0, 10); makeGlobalObject(2940, 3350, 2094, 0, 10); makeGlobalObject(2940, 3349, 2093, 0, 10); makeGlobalObject(2940, 3348, 2097, 0, 10); makeGlobalObject(2940, 3347, 2103, 0, 10); makeGlobalObject(2940, 3346, 2105, 0, 10); makeGlobalObject(3029, 3361, 3828, 0, 10); makeGlobalObject(2991, 3379, 2470, 0, 10); makeGlobalObject(3024, 3365, 10638, 0, 10); makeGlobalObject(3029, 3365, 6552, 0, 10);
Add under that:

makeGlobalObject(####, ####, 6552, 0, 10);

To make it better add it like this:

makeGlobalObject(tox, toy, 6552, 0, 10);

Tox and toy are the cordinates.

Then search for:

if (objectID ==

Under a code of objectID add:

if (objectID == 6552) { } if (playerAncientMagics == 1) { setSidebarInterface(6, 1151); // magic tab (ancient = 12855); // /normal = 1151 playerAncientMagics = 0; sM("You convert to normal magic!"); } else if (playerAncientMagics == 0 ) { setSidebarInterface(6, 12855); // magic tab (ancient = 12855); playerAncientMagics = 1; sM("You convert to ancient magicks!");

There you go.

Read full topic
